result.execSummary:
The defendant Destin J Wilbon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Pay fine of $25.00 plus all mandatory costs, fees and DNA surcharges to be paid by 11/24/16 or serve 20 consecutive days in the HOC.
*Credit for 5 days time served. Give DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Destin J Wilbon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
20 days HOC, consecutive.
DUE & OWING

Defendant Destin J Wilbon in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  FIVE DAYS  in the House of Correction,  with credit for FIVE days time served. Give DNA sample

Fine of $25.00 PLUS ALL MANDATORY costs, fees and dna surcharges  to be paid by 11-24-16 or serve 20 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

NOTE:  Court directs the Clerk of Courts Office to notify the Department of Motor Vehicles that  ZERO DAYS (0 days) REVOCATION should be imposed in this case.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Destin J Wilbon in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Destin J Wilbon in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-19-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Destin J Wilbon in court.  Denis John Stingl appeared for Nick Cerwin for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 47.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

ADDRESS INFO for Destin J Wilbon
Current: 139 E Concordia, Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 07-31-2015)
Prior: 4158 West Good Hope Road, Milwaukee, WI 53209

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Destin J Wilbon in court.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Destin J Wilbon not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7-21-2015 at 1:30pm
